Lots of crispy rice and flavorful sausage; better than Champa Garden and Maneelap.

*Lard Ped Krod: Crispy Duck Salad ($14): http://bit.ly/1Rw6WMz
It was 80% duck so can't complain about that but needed more lime.

*Kang Ped: Red Curry w/ duck ($16): http://bit.ly/1UfuFHO 
Curry sauce was robust with a nice sweetness. Duck was fatty and tender. 

*Durian w/ black sticky rice ($7): http://bit.ly/1MxiDBt
Deliciously stinky and the rice was nicely sticky and nutty. 
 
: : D  E  C  E  N  T  ::
*Pad Thai Kai Hor: Pad Thai Omelet ($15): http://bit.ly/1ZkjnBc
Fluffy eggs but noodles were soggy and needed more tamarind or lime.

*Yum Koh Moo Yang: Grilled Pork Neck ($12): http://bit.ly/1U1pJG9  
Tender but not as deliciously fatty as Lers Ros; some pieces were tough, and dry around the edges. 

*Tom Saap Kra Dook Mo Pork: Spicy Rib Soup ($14): http://bit.ly/22s50jy
Tender ribs but broth lacked depth. 

*Tom Khaa: Coconut Soup w/ shrimp ($14): bit.ly/1LBa3XA
Coconutty, good heat but didn't try any of the seafood. 


: : S  K  I  P : : 
*Crispy Pork Belly w/ sweet basil ($14): http://bit.ly/1Sd1EZz 
Meat was really dry and hard around the edges. 

*Tom Yum Seafood Fried Rice ($15):  http://bit.ly/1Mxjn9N 
Overwhelming lemongrass flavor, clumpy, and oily. 

*Duck Fried Rice ($16): http://bit.ly/1Sd1P75 
Lacks what Chinese call "wok hay". The rice was clumpy, soggy, and lacked a slight smokiness.  

*Pad See Yew: Stir Fried Rice Noodles w beef ($13): http://bit.ly/1Uy2UcZ 
Clumpy and mushy. 

*Kao Mun Kai ($14): http://bit.ly/1ZkkTmX
Flavorful chicken rice but the chicken was sloppily sliced and poorly poached. The chicken (dark meat) was dry. Really disappointing.   

*Nam Prik w/ Thai Sausage ($25): http://bit.ly/1Zkl4P3
Sloppily sliced, mealy sausage. Green chili dip was mushy, bland, and one dimensional. Way overpriced for $25. 

*Coconut Ice Cream ($7): Cloying sweet; tasted like piña colada (pineapple chucks).

While the staff was cordial, they were very green. Our poor server wasn't familiar with the menu (who would be at 100+ items!) and had to confirm our order three separate times. I don't expect stellar service at Asian restaurants but I expected some follow-up since we were paying auto-gratuity for a large group and prices are higher than the standard Thai restaurant. No one checked on us to see how the food was and we had to constantly flag someone down when we needed something. We asked for hot sauce for the table and they gave us a small communal rack of hot sauces. They later asked to take it away when we were STILL using it. That's like having one set of ketchup and mustard bottles at a diner! 

At the end of dinner, the staff brought the birthday boy coconut ice cream with a candle in it and sang happy birthday for him. What a nice gesture I thought until...I saw they charged us $7 for it. The phuck? 

I rarely take pics of receipts but I did so in this case so I can refer to it when writing a review. When I was looking back at the receipt last night to remind me of the dishes we ordered, I noticed that they charged us 11.9% for tax: http://bit.ly/1UfxRmS?! If the "Healthy SF Tax" is included, that should be listed as a separate line item charge. 

Saap Ver doesn't hold a candle to Lers Ros (original TL location) and Kin Khao. I question the authenticity of many of the glowing 5 star reviews especially when they choose Saap Ver to be their first restaurant to review. Ever.

But who cares about what I think. 

What did birthday boy who's a professional chef and trained in Thailand for Muay Thai think about the food at Saap Ver? 

"It was authentic but ehh...it was ok", he said. 

But he thought the bartender was hawt. Now, if she sang Happy Birthday, Marilyn Monroe style to him, the $7 charge would have been worth it!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Fresh, quick and tasty Thai food. I have tried the pad-kraw-pao and vegetarian mixed vegetable curry both of which are great. Dine in and take out are both great options!
author: Ruchi M.

description: Wonderful people with very attentive service. The food is excellent, spicy and flavourful and in abundance. We always think we ordered too much, and think we'll have leftovers to take home, but nope. It's too good. We almost always eat everything right there.
author: Laura S.

description: I ordered from here for a few times, but the food is inconsistent and spice/hotness levels are all over the place. Medium spicy is completely bland one day and feels like you have been set on fire another day.
author: Daniel Q.

description:
The ambiance is a bit overly stimulating. Then again, maybe I can contentedly chalk it up to an authentic experience. When I visit Thailand, I might get back to ya. 

Ordered two pad see ew dishes and a beer. Both my brother and I were underwhelmed by the food, which could have used extra sauce, eggs, and more tender beef. My brother said his beer was okay.
author: Paulina F.

description:
I went for lunch here last week along with my daughter who had tried them before

Everything we got was quite delicious.  
My daughter is on crutches and I am Rishi eight that the staff was very courteous to her
author: amy W.

description: Solid Thai food if you are in the area or can't stand the wait at Dumpling Time across the street. Lively atmosphere and lots of seating. Huge menu with a wide variety in prices - entrees ranging from around $14 to $30. I had the seafood curry which was fantastic. Friend had the fried rice with tofu and enjoyed it.
author: Robin P.

description:
The food is good here, but...

I placed an online order today and waited 52 minutes to get it. Every staff member kept telling me "yes, yes, it's coming" when I asked.  Finally, they figured out that the order was never given to the kitchen.
author: Michael G.

description: Nothing authentic about this food. My lunch came with iceberg lettuce coated in 1000 island dressing. I have been to Thailand and never once was I ever served 1000 island dressing. Overpriced and portions are small
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I'm done with Saap Ver, the service is bad, takes forever to get your check and now they have raised their prices and charge $3 or more to add chicken to any dish or make request. The food was already expensive. 

$50 for lunch for 3 ridiculous. I will spend my money and time somewhere else, I recommend you do the same!

GREED HAS SET IN AT SAAP, a death nail!
author: T. O.

description: I used to come here. The food and service was good. One day I ordered Khao Mun Gai (chicken on rice) and they served chicken that was cooked the day before. This was unacceptable. Imagine your favorite bakery selling you day old pastries as "freshly baked".
author: Reza H.

description: Best Thai food in the city hands down. Service is exceptional and beer is always ice cold. If you like chicken noodle soup, order it with egg noodles or vermicelli noodles, its ridiculous.  Especially on cold, rainy days.
author: Josh G.

description: Saap Ver is an interesting place. Their menu is extremely extensive, and everything that I've had has been fine - just fine. Service every time I've been here has been really lax, but there's almost always only one server helping the entire restaurant. What makes Saap Ver stand out is how caring that limited service is. We came in during a Warriors game (go Dubs!) and they let us take up a 4 top so we could both watch the game at the same time. It's the little things that count!
author: Christina S.

description:
+ Have fresh coconut juice in a coconut
+ Green curry was good, but a bit overpriced

Not worth going out of your way to go to.
author: Margaret R.

description:
Im not sure really how to start!  Every Friday we order lunch as an office and try to mix it up to all of the restaurants in the area.  But 3 times out of 3 orders, we have had nothing but issues.

The first and second experiences were just simple substitutions for items we ordered.  Both times we went to pick up our order, we have had to pick something new off of the menu.  Its a little frustrating when you are looking forward to what you ordered and then to have to pick something else.  I have worked in many restaurants so I do understand things do run out, but it seems weird that it happened twice.

But this last time was the last.  After avoiding the road construction to get there and having my colleagues all excited, they did not have our order at all.  It just upped and vanished from the person that took the order over the phone
author: Zachary A.

description:
It's hard to get more authentic that this spot! When you see other Thai people eating there, you know this place is a gem!

I ordered the duck larb, pad Thai, and green curry. When you ask for medium spicy, they really mean it! The duck larb was my favorite out of all the dishes. Although, if they had any of the crispy pork belly left for me to order, I bet that would take the gold medal!

The ambiance is also just plain fun! You'll see posters of old Thai movies and it transports you to a touristy spot straight outta Bangkok!

What's next? I'm getting that pork belly for takeout!
author: Nitar L.

description: We ordered Som Tom with crabs, fried rice, BBQ chicken, pad Thai wrapped with eggs then coconut ice cream. The food was very delicious and authentic. The service was very good and very professional. I would go back again for another round...
author: Max H.

description: Those of you that come to this restaurant thinking pad Thai or green curry is going to be their best dish should stay away from this establishment. It's too bad people unfamiliar with Thai cuisine thinks they can ding the place down because their pan fried noodle dish didn't taste the same as another watered down place. We ordered som tum, Kao moo yang, and laap nan tok, and a giant grilled fish complete with roasted egg plant on the side. We felt like we were back in bangkok and truly enjoyed this place. This place is 5 stars. Let me know if you need help ordering
author: Otto T.

description: Probably my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. It's super underrated. Food is very authentic and has lots of flavor. Staff are also very nice and friendly.
author: Vinayak P.

description:
Literally the best Thai Restaurant in San Francisco! The food is authentic as well as amazingly delicious! A few dishes come to mind are :

PECK GAI Salted Chicken Wings 

THAI HERB SAUSAGE    Northern Style Pork Sausage 

LUK CHIN PHING       Grilled Meatballs (Pork or Beef), Sweet Chili Sauce 

KOH MOO YANG                Grilled Pork Neck 

GAI YANG                         BBQ Chicken with Sweet Chili Sauce  

CRYING ThaIGilR         Grilled Rib Eye Steak, Roasted Rice, Chili-Lime Sauce 

GRILLED PORK NECK SALAD       Spicy Roasted Rice Powder 

GRILLED PRAWNS SALAD      Lemongrass, Fresh Mint  

LARB         Minced Pork or Chicken, Chili Powder, Roasted Rice, Chili-Lime Dressing 

RICE FIELD CRAB SOM TUM      Rice Field Salted Crab, fermented fish

TOM SAAP KRA DOOK MOO Spicy Sour Pork Spare Rib Soup, Roasted Rice Powder 

PAD THAI Pan-Fried Rice Noodle, Tofu, Chive, Peanut, Bean Sprout 

LARB PLA Whole Fish Salad, Thai Herbs, Spicy-Lime Roasted Rice Dressing 

CRISPY PORK BELLY BASIL      Stir-fried pork belly, chili, bell pepper, green bean 

CRISPY PORK BELLY KA-NA      Stir-fried pork belly, Chinese broccoli, oyster sauce

The owner and staff are unbelievable! Very friendly. My complements to the chef! An absolute delight!
author: Eddy M.

description: My lunch of  steamed Chicken Ginger rice was accompanied by a  lively chili sauce that gave the dish some punch. Look forward to exploring the menu further.
author: Steve T.

description:
The best Thai food in town 
First time when I go this place I ordered 5-6 order everything it's delicious and fresh if you find authentic thai food in town I highly recommend this restaurant!!
author: Bancha S.

description: Second time coming here. This place has never disappointed me. We ordered Chiang Mai style pork dip, fried pork and grilled pork shoulder. Both pork diahes were tendered and juicy. The sauce was great. It was  not sweet at all (thai food shouldn't be sweet). Will definitely coming back again.
author: Pim N.

description:
Nope. Not for us. Being honest we received 10% off for complaining.

Duck is ultra fatty, one of the crab dishes smells like sweaty feet.

Al that said, we're not of the age range that frequents this place, if you're under 30, you may well enjoy it a whole lot more than we did.
author: John R.

description: Excellent Thai food that has the feel of sitting outdoors, eating street food -- except inside, with no humidity! The egg pancake is delicious as are the curries. Inventive cocktails, too. And -- plenty of parking on a Saturday night.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Service amazing. Mgmt staff friendly and engaged with customer service. Ambiance very hipster like yet inviting to family meal time. Lastly the food, well, one of best yet in Thai cuisine. 
Have to admit that I still enjoyed Lotus Siam of Vegas a bit more but outside this place, but it's one of best I've had in continental US, from coast to coast. To make it even better, prices were very reasonable. This is a hidden gem waiting to be discovered. Actually, they're already Michelin recommended only about a year since opening. Strong recommend!
author: Mush S.

description:
Convenient parking, scrumptious food, and caring service. 

Came as a group of three, and since one of us was vegetarian, we ordered all our dishes with no meat. Surprisingly, I had no craving for meat during the entire meal. We ordered the yellow curry with fried tofu, veggie fried rice, and extra spicy pad kee mao. Each dish took me on a completely different flavorful journey. Yes hunny, yes. 

We also ordered the watermelon drink. I forget what it was called but it was hella good. The only recommendation I have, is that they should give us larger plates. We were eating off of plates that were quite small so I couldn't serve myself as much food as I wanted (no worries, they have large food portions). Also, there could be larger straws. There were really small straws (the size of a coffee stirrer) for our watermelon drink. Basically I wanted to take enormous bites and gulps of everything because it was so darn delicious. :-P 

I'll be back!!
author: Ani R.

description:
Lived here for 8 years. This place is the old grand Pu bah and since it's the same cuisine it's hard not to compare. 

Honestly, I miss grand Pu bah. The decor for in better in this design district. Saap ver is Thailand street food style decor, very eccentric, random and authentic but it doesn't fit in well in this neighborhood. Honestly there's too much going on it made me anxious. 

I ordered pad see ewe $13. Service was fast. Food was ok. It had much more sauce than needed; way too much sodium for my liking. Aldo the menu was all over the place and really hard to read. I was looking for the normal rice and egg plant and chicken dish that's typical for Thai restaurants. They had something like that listed but it said fried and I don't like fried food. I defaulted to pad see ewe. 

Service was nice. There's no host so I had to flag someone down. Overall it's not bad but I liked the classy, modern grand Pu bag where we can take high end clients.

Btw lots of gnats. Is that a health code violation?
author: Lucky N.

description:
Food is good. Drinks are good. Place is clean. Take out is fast. What's not to like? If you don't like spicy food, don't get any of the spicy items and ask for mild or medium thinking you can handle it because here, spicy means spicy. I find the menu to have good variety and is a good change from the usual Thai place that just has pad Thai and curries. 

I've had their drinks and it's definitely got creativity and much more flare than I expected. I also enjoy the decor. I only wish they would stop playing really obscure sports games all the time and show something else besides sports once in a while.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Excellent Thai with a versatile menu.

We tried everything family style. From curries to noodles to a whole fish, I think we sampled everything.

All the dishes were delicious and more authentically made than other places I have frequented. 

My favorite was the chicken curry paired with sticky rice and the pad Thai. The fish was also cooked creatively, covered in an insane amount of salt but when you peel back the skin the flesh is seasoned juuuuusst right.

The iced tea was awesome. Kept me up for a good 4 hours after dinner but hey, Netflix preparedness right?
author: Neesh Q.

description: This is one of my favorite place in city. Everything so good! People is really nice and good was amazing! Love this place forever!!!
author: Serah P.

description:
+ Food is delicious. Heads up: 'Medium' spicy at this restaurant means REALLY SPICY. I love Korean food and can eat all of the mega spicy Korean food brings...but this Thai 'medium' spicy nearly god damn killed me.  I didn't even finish my food, I ate about half, before my mouth decided to throw the towel in. Can't complain, eating less just means I won't get fat, right? Fresh ingredients and excellent spices.

- SERVICE IS TERRIBLE which is why I give this place such a low rating. I walked in to order takeout at 1230pm, Friday and it was very busy.  I understand that I may not get the best service when it's busy, however the people today did not acknowledge me once. So after 5 minutes, I ordered lunch from the Eat24 app. Said it would be ready in 10-35 minutes.  40 minutes later, I'm still waiting inside the restaurant btw, sitting, with no one acknowledging why I am sitting there for 45 minutes, I ask a server if he could check on my order and I provide him my name. He walks away and never comes back. When I finally see him again, he's bagging up an order and placing it on the side and continues to serve the eat-in customers.

I naturally assumed it was not my take out as he has my name and he knows I am waiting.  I WAS WRONG.  I waiting another 10 minutes and a different server looks at the order and says, 'Oh this one is yours, right?"  WTF.  

I waited a total of 55 minutes for my takeout order. During that time I watched multiple customers wait in frustration for their late take away orders and for incorrect take away orders as well. I will never order takeout or even sit-in at this restaurant.  The food is good, but it's not that good where I will put up with the shitty service.
author: Tara K.

description: Wow! Our birthday dinner here was a night to remember! I was lucky enough to have made a reservation 2 weeks prior for a party of 15 on a busy Saturday night. Our server was hilarious, and attentive to our needy requests. Even with a large group, we felt very well taken care of. When they found out it was my birthday, I was given a shot of whisky right after placing our orders (and ... many more shots given on the house after). The dishes were yummy and flavorful, my friends got to taste a variety of things on the menu-- it was definitely reasonably priced for what you can find in the city. It was actually very difficult finding a place that fits our budget, and still accommodates for our large group. I was so glad to have found this place. It was such a fun atmosphere, and the employees couldn't have been more friendlier. I think it was also the owner's birthday, and I was lucky enough to take a shot with him, then proceeding to be pulled on stage to dance.
author: Qiqi W.

description:
We almost always get food as "take-out" here... it's a bit noisy inside... and I'm getting old and cranky... 

As to the food: it's great!

Lots of variety on the menu. And all the dishes we've tried have been delicious. I recommend!
author: Marcus L.

description:
The food and cocktails are super tasty! A fun spot for both lunch and dinner. They even have a full bar, and lots of TVs to watch games! But it doesn't have that sports bar feel, and the TVs are easy to ignore (in the bar area) if you want to. 

The Pad Thai and the Fried Chicken Ginger Rice are my favorites. And try their Happy Hour too!
author: Jaching H.

description:
This place is pretty fly. And by that I mean 4 out of 6 of the drinks on the table had little flies in them. Waitress wasn't even surprised, didn't act like she had no idea what it was - we all know at this point.

Sugar Ray would love it here. He just wants a fly.
author: Shaun P.

description:
Very fun place, one of the better Thai restaurants in the city. 

So far I've had the seafood pad see ew - not too oily like others I've had which is good. 

You can see the crab in the crab fried rice. 

The basil duck was super flavorful. Though a tad bit too salty, we still cleaned the plate!
author: Nathan C.

description: Great food and great customer service. Everything is good but the whole fried fish larb is to die for!
author: Sharon Rika O.

description:
Had been wanting to try this place for sometime. As you walk in the decor is impressive much like Farmhouse which currently holds my heart for favorite thai place in the city. 

Lunch:
Service here is very friendly , and I got a curry dish. The price was about $13 which seems high but is on par for SF thai establishments.  What comes out is a small dish of curry and a small scoop of rice. If i had to be picky I would say maybe a little more rice would be nice for the dish.  The curry is served in a typical thai fashion which is a pyramid with it's top chopped off. (edit: This shape has a name.. I was curious and referenced Senor Google and it's called a Frustum). Saying the word word Frustum is Frust-rating b/c it doesn't roll off the lips quite right does it?? Moving along...

It doesn't appear that there is much curry in the Frustum but there is indeed a good amount of meat/heartiness in the oddly named bowl.  They ask you for spiciness level here and the taste/spiciness level was just how I like it . 

As I mentioned the service here was awesome as well. 

I now have Saap Ver and Farmhouse Thai as my two favorite SF thai establishments and look forward to returning. 

-
author: Rod M.

description:
******************** 1542 ******************** 

    I came here when it was another Thai Spot, love the bar then, and it stays the same. Although the kitchen and the walls are all redecorated, street food style, nice design, taken you back to the old days.

  My best friend and I ordered a bit of everything. The papaya salad, the soup, the park belly, the fish, the whole fried fish was out on Sunday when we were there. We were disappointed. I guess we need another trip back.

   Love, love, love the fish sauce and Thai chili pot!!!

   The place was 1/3 full when we were there. Service was good and attentive. The drink list was nice. They even have Champagne by the glass. Riesling is the way to go. We shall be back.
author: Manda Bear B.

description: We tried the sea bass and fried wings. Liked their service. We will visit again. The sea bass was cooked in a  clay pot with veggies. Very flavorful.
author: Gomz G.

description:
This place is underrated and deserves a bump up. Eating here brings me back to Thailand, particularly Bangkok. The flavors are on point and the atmosphere is very laid back. I've been four times now and each and every time the waiters and waitresses have been great at recommending dishes I haven't tried before.

It's great for large groups and often times, there's no wait. Great food, great atmosphere, great service. I couldn't ask for more.
author: Ansi T.

description:
Delicious food but I ate 4 or 5 flies with my meal.

Green Papaya Salad with Sticky Rice: 4.5 stars
I got this with BBQ chicken and got a huge drumstick and 2 thighs. Super yummy meal but I was distracted by the cloud of flies landing in my salad sauce and on the rice and on my nose, etc.

Re: the ambience, I find it a bit strange that they took down the fancy high-end Grand Pu-Bah decor to replace it with a kitschy faux-street hawker vibe, but hey whatever the food is good. For the price you pay though, I expect better hygiene standards than a street in Bangkok.


---- UPDATE Aug 29 2017 ----

I've returned a few times and there have never been as many flies as on my first visit so I'm revising upwards to 4 stars.

---- NOODLES ----

Pad See Ew: 3.5 stars
Got mine with pork. Satisfying enough, but too salty. I'll try asking for reduced salt next time.

Rad Na: 4.5 stars
Asked for reduced salt and it was perfect. Lots of delicious gravy.

Chicken Noodle Soup: 3.5 stars

BBQ Pork and Wonton Noodle Soup: 4 stars


---- RICE ----

Chicken Fried Rice: 4 stars

Five Spice Pork Leg with Rice: 3.5 stars
author: Letitia L.

description: Great authentic food and a great casual atmosphere. Ate here while the NBA finals were going on and was a very lively environment, lots of fun. Food was also very delicious and had a very authentic vibe to it. Had the pad Thai which had a great twist of having a layer of egg over it, and the noodles were amazing. If you want to add a little heat, I'd recommend their chili sauce that was really great.
author: Roger L.

description:
Really delicious food. Unfortunately, the service is pretty terrible. Servers are nice enough, but very inattentive and people in one party are not served their orders at one time, so people just watch each other eat their meals. 

Recommend for takeout. Not for dining in.
author: Chip S.

description:
This place is great!! Wonderful atmosphere and the food is even better. Glad a great restaurant finally came into this spot as the one before was horrible. Every time I come it's a great experience.

Thanks for making me a happy Jew!
author: David F.

description:
Been to Thailand many times - The Chiang Mai Sausage is on the sweet side - it was VERY good, but not as spicy as I expected. the serving size was quite ample. Chicken Satay - only two kabobs but, authentic enough. My friend had the duck on a bed of rice, which was excellent(!) -  with not so much fat. I ordered the chicken Thai basil (think larb) which was, if I closed my eyes - VERY authentic/delicious. Service was friendly and non-rushed (we were seated at around 1:00 on a weekday).
Having been to "Lers" just a few days ago - I found the price of lunch much easier to swallow here at Saap Ver - I can't wait to go back and explore the dinner menu!
author: James M.

description:
Tom yum noodle was alright, the flavor is good but was way too oily. Unlike the other traditional Thai noodles I've ordered, they don't have different variety of noodles, it came with pho noodles. Pretty disappointed - Pa-Ord (in Los Angeles) is still the best. 

Partner ordered the crispy rice salad and that was not good, it's weird that they added so much ginger to the salad.
author: Kym L.

description: When they say on authentic  food they really mean authentic. Food was great hair food took a while to come but food was really good it was delicious one of my favorite Cuisines no complaints here.
author: Meishi M.

description:
Was excited to see a new Thai restaurant open up here. I thought it was new ownership from the last Thai establishment in the same spot because of the different styling of the restaurant, new waiters/waitresses, and a slightly different style of food. But the expensive menu and lingering service issues make me wonder if some of Grand Pu Bah is still here.

Have eaten here twice since they've opened and had poor dining experiences overall both times. The first time, it took a long time for the wait staff to take our order, and then when it came out, they were delivered so far apart that we had to have that awkward conversation of "no, please go ahead and eat, your food will get cold." The first and last dish were delivered at least 15 minutes apart, which is ridiculous when you're trying to share a meal with some one. I also asked for medium spice level and it was scalding my mouth, and usually I order hot at restaurants but just wasn't in the mood this day. The spice inconsistency was an issue at Grand Pu Bah as well.

The second time was even worse. One of our table members ordered a soup which came in this large circular steel epic presentation, but then she had to stare at it for 15 minutes before even the second of our six dishes came out. When they all finally came out, we were trying to get a bowl and spoon for her to eat the soup out of, and that took multiple requests, when finally I just got up and went and found spoons and bowls, and silverware for the table. I felt bad for the waitstaff because they were running around like crazy, so it's probably a new restaurant/understaffed problem. 

Really bad experience here, and will not return. Food is decent, but the service situation was so bad both times that it pretty much negates any potentially redeeming qualities.
author: Sarah B.

description:
This place is probably my new to go place!
Bring your friends here, soupy an order more food to share. 

They have full bar, there you go! Full Choices of beers/ wines/ cocktails. 

I would definitely recommend set nam prik. They are all tasty and healthy.
author: Fah Z.

description:
I got a combo with sausage, sticky rice, pork rinds, peanuts, chilis, cabbage.

I really liekd the pork rinds, peanuts, cabbage.

Sausage was pretty spicy.   The green chilis were insanely hot, i cried.


This resturant is super loud, uncomfortably loud.   I didn't feel like shouting so we just sat quietly ate and left.
author: Michael E.

description:
Food is always delicious here and consistent. Service is fast and friendly 
We always get the fried fish larb it's sooo good!
author: Marie r.

description:
Great food! Taste authentic and loved every bite. I would have given 5 stars if just based on that. 
However, the service was horrible. Walked in with the place half full and yet it took the servers quite some time before they noticed we were waiting to be seated. 

After ordering, we tried to flag someone and one of the guy rudely pointed to our faces and told us to wait while he go on with something else

Our original server forgot that we ordered a beer and when asked, she gave us a puzzled look. Halfway through our food, we ran out of water and no one noticed or bothered to check on us. 

I would go back for the food but the service really threw us off.
author: WQ C.

description:
I went their for the first time with my friends and this is a new place we 'd like to hang out.  As i'm Thai, the theme of the restaurant reminds me of the old  days which I love it. It seems to me that the owner put a lot of effort to start this place.
We ordered many classic Thai dishes, such as fish cake, Grilled Tilapia, Papaya salad, Tom yum noodle soup. The food was superp. It was Authentic Thai. 
When comes to the deserts, we had coconut ice cream which they served in fresh coconut shell. It was beautiful and the taste was so good. We also ordered Durian in coconut milk with sticky rice. This desert is rare, but they have it here.

The servers and the owner are very sweet. Good service. We 'll come back to try more.
author: Saowalak F.

description:
Great decoration ,spacious , I'm thinking about bring a group of my friend here , authentic Thai  food ,absolutely taste like what you eat in Thailand
We order meat ball(dipping sauce is the killer)
Tom Saap (tasty!!) and grill tilapia (grilled perfectly, the fish is so moist and flavorful , 3 dipping sauce is perfect) 
Must eat here!!
author: Wirunna W.

description:
This place is a luxury authentic Thai food.
I recommended this place for friend who need to eat North east Thai food.
Tum Sua and fish grill with sea are the unique Thai food that you will never eat in another place in San Francisco.
author: Naomi N.

description:
Ordered take out from this place and although I think it was good. There were way better options in the bay area.

The pad thai was okay nothing too exciting.

The spicy spareribs were really good. I would come back just for that.

Pineapple rice could have been better.
author: Brian N.

description:
Food: 5 stars. Ordered sour pork soup, pork neck salad, and a noodle dish. All good.

Service: 5

Environment: 5 

Price: 4 . It is a little bit pricy than other this level restaurants. This place serve wines. This could be a reason. 

Will come back
author: Fangfang O.

description: Yum! This Thai food is excellent! The menu is extremely large and packed with delicious items. The interior of the space is unique and there are large screens if you want to watch a football game. They have bar seating, which is nice if you want to grab a drink. They do offer some unique drink options as well that seem to come in fruits. I would suggest getting the pad see ew with chicken. It is a large portion meal that will lease you extremely satisfied!
author: Zoe Z.

description:
This Thai restaurant is a nice addition to the design district/Potrero hill area. The restaurant shows Thai movies in the evening and has Thai themed movie art work on the wall. The focus of this restaurant is Thai street food so don't expect to see a large menu. I've been to this restaurant twice and would say the my experience was between a 3 and 4. I really liked the Kra Pow Gai as it was very flavorful, maybe could have used a bit more spice, but had the right texture, ingredients, and consistency. As for the Som Tum Set, the chicken BBQ was not my favorite. The texture of the chicken was fine, but in my opinion there wasn't a lot of meat on the chicken wings. I spent the majority of my meal trying to figure out how to get the small pieces of meat off the wing. This dish comes with a papaya salad which was intended to be the appetizer, but was the highlight of the dish for me. It was flavorful, had a nice tangy kick and had little shrimp in the dish. My husband and I were both impressed with this salad and wished it was a stand alone menu item. Another item I've tried at this restaurant is the cabbage the dish. The cabbage had the perfect texture after being cooked in the wok and had a nice garlicky flavor. 

The service at this establishment was decent. The first time I came it was impressive, but the second time I am visited it was slow and they accidentally switched our bill with another patrons. I think this establishment has a lot of potential and hope they continue to refine their menu and work the kinks out in their service.
author: Dawn B.

description:
Food is really good and the decoration is awesome like come for the movie scene .
I want to recommend the server named "Joy". She is very kind and friendly. I will come back again because this is so great!!!
author: Piyathida N.

description: Argh, growing pains and a full house means some of the wonderful details of my first visits are diminishing. The white cabbage on the plate, this detail I so eagerly cherish because of it's authenticity all throughout Thailand, is something that is now missing. Also the chicken is getting tougher. I have faith in the chef and staff, and it is most definitely tough to scale Thai food, but please pull through on this one. So much talent here. Dont' become just another Thai spot.
author: Brian J.

description:
Saap Ver is a very vibrant Thai restaurant and bar, full of colorful flags with vintage Thai movie posters plastered across the walls. I went on a Monday evening around 7 PM, and the place was lively (especially because Game 5 of the NBA Finals was happening) but there were plenty of tables open so we were seated immediately.

I got the Pad See Ew with beef. The portions were very large, but the meat was a bit overcooked and tough. In my experience, pad see ew tends to be on the sweet side, but their version had some interesting spiciness going on, with some hints of ginger and pepper. Overall, a decent dish.

The service was very nice, but the food was slow to come out. At $12 pre-tax for the pad see ew, it's a little on the pricey side for Thai. This is the first Thai place I've in SF, so I don't have much to compare it to, but it doesn't quite match up to my favorite spot in NYC. I probably wouldn't get the pad see ew again, but would be willing to go back to try some of their more specialized dishes.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Big portions. Authentic food and people. Good energy inside and a nice layout. I recommend the coconut soup.
author: Cassie J.

description: These guys have nailed it when it comes to creating a great ambiance. Very open airy space with good decoration and multiple TVs for watching games. The menus variety is impressive and I enjoyed many of the dishes. Definitely a staple!
author: Anant P.

description: The food was really good and came out very quickly but like a lot of Thai places, there's not a lot of emphasis on plating apps and soups first. We got our fresh rolls (the rice paper was not soft but the hard rehydrated kind on the outside of Vietnamese goi cuon if they'd been refrigerated), then came the crispy pork belly and Chinese broccoli and pad see ew (I ordered Pad Kee Mao but whatevs). We had to wait a bit to get the fried egg and ginger rice. Then after about 10 minutes we got our soup. Everything was over the top delicious, so it lived up to its name, but then service just kind of disappeared. I watched as two tables in the restaurant get extra attention while everyone else just got ok service. All in all, food was good but service was lack luster.
author: Jeff K.

description: Foods was so good!! I had bloody clam salad and kow kruk krapi. Can't find any where like this place. Definitely come back again!!! Never disappointed!!'
author: Nam T.

description: Saap Ver is my favorite restaurant in the whole city, and I eat out fairly often.  I have been a loyal patron for years and go there at least once a week.  The food is consistently delicious and I love the crab som tum and naked prawns.  I have tried other Thai restaurants, but none of them measure up to Saap Ver's awesomeness.  The staff is super friendly and accomodating.  Go to Saap Ver if you want great Thai food and a fun atmosphere.
author: Tanya B.

description:
Saap Ver is a delicious Thai spot out in SF. It's not my favorite by any means, nor is it the best, however they do have a few treats on their menu that I just can't get enough of. Their Nam Tok (grilled pork salad) might be the best I've had here in the States. It is perfection. The Issan Thai sausage is absolutely incredible as well. Their Som Tum is also quite good but it doesn't quite hit the mark. I also love their coconut ice cream for dessert.
I love the interior arrangement as well. Bright & colorful with all sorts of old Thai movie posters up on the walls. It's a large establishment and quite comfortable. IT's a fun place to have a meal, that's for sure.
I will say in all honesty that their are many dishes at Saap Ver that miss the mark by miles. Their crab fried rice "Kow Pad Boo" for instance is a shame. That dish is a staple of Thai cuisine and it's really disappointing at Saap. 
All in all I'm a fan. The goods outweigh the negative.
author: Gilbey G.

description:
Violated the federal law Americans With Disabilities Act, refused me service with service dog. They seated me, brought me water, took my order, and then told me I had to leave. Service dog was sitting quietly under table.

They stated I had to show proof of service dog, in direct violation of the ADA, even after I explained the law and spoke to a manager, who questioned me over and over if I was "sure" it's a service dog.
author: Amanda L.

description: I wish this was in my neighborhood! Very good with lots of fresh veggies. Tom Kha and Pad Kee Mao we're done very well. We were starving from a long travel day, had just gotten off a plane without too much time until closing, but the server was very friendly and made sure everything came out quickly as we requested.
author: Julia P.

description:
My boyfriend and I had heard about this place when it first opened and finally got a chance to try it this past weekend. We were not disappointed. It was probably some of the best thai I've had in the city. The only downside is that the menu is really extensive so it's easy to order too much food :) You'll probably want to try everything.

It's a casual spot, but fun decor and the staff is super friendly. A good setting for groups and/or happy hour. Maybe a little pricier than your average takeout but so worth it.

We ordered the pad thai hor kai, tom yum soup, crispy larb wontons and the fresh rolls. We definitely will go back to try more. It's nice to have another thai option in the area.
author: Bethany D.

description:
I love Thai food ! 
this is the place where you're looking for authentic Thai street food  
the best Som Tum Poo Plara  but some Americans never had a chance to know what Poo Pla ra is  ,   Poo Pla ra combine with several dimensions of flavor   Salty and sour are the main flavor of Poo Pla ra
so no doubt why mostly of American people can not understand the palate of Som Tum Poo Pla Ra  

I just give a little bit orientation for papaya salad for yelper out there ;)
author: Noah P.

description:
Delicious Thai food! Great ambiance and service. Would definitely be coming back!

We got the pork skewers, some ground chicken salad, deep fried pork salad, and pork belly with basil. I don't remember the name, but look at photos uploaded. Very spicy, per our request. Also the lychee martinis are devine!
author: Dee H.

description: Great Thai food great atmosphere full bar you got to go. When was a group of fans had a great time highly recommended
author: Kent W.

description:
Food  and service are very very good it's seems like I am in thailand the food is really authentic.


Should come to try here.
author: Princess M.

description: This is my go-to Thai place. Everything is so good, the staff are wonderful, and the atmosphere is inviting. The samosas and Thai iced tea are must-tries!
author: Kira G.

description: Being from Thailand, I am super picky about my food. My go to spot use to be Sai Jai Thai. I have been holding out on reviewing this place because I really didn't want to share this spot with everyone. However, with that being said. I have brought countless friends here and now they secretly go without me. So damn rude. The menu varies so I always ask what's new. I really enjoy Thai northeastern food such and the papaya combo with Thai BBQ chicken and sticky rice. It's pretty on point. They always change their menu up so there is always something good to try. I just wish they would change up there dessert menu is all. Seriously, why don't you have mango and sticky rice? It's okay I'll just go to Mitchells after.
author: Andy D.

description: Really good food and very nice staff. Clean restaurant and unique decor. The noodle soups are awesome. Thai Tea.They also have a big projector tv for sports.
author: Douglas M.

description:
Came to set up events over the weekend. Saap Ver (formally Grand Bhu Bar),  revamp the place & menu. The chef/co-owner is well known amongst Thai community for cooking very authentic n flavorful food. 

I was in SF for 3 days n went over for dinner 2 nights this trip.  Was also there the beginning of the month. Can't get enough. 

Most of want I always get are the north-eastern Thai (Isarn) food which consists of Papaya salad, grilled salted-Talapia (limited per day), Moo nam-tok,  delicious spare ribs,  Tom-sap spare ribs (spicy Thai style soup). Pad-cha Talay (seafood in chili paste & fresh pepper) is authentic. All pairs perfectly with Singha beer from Thailand. 

If u are up for a challenge for authentic Thai food,  with  unique decors, u will love the place. It's my favorite place in SF. If u see a lot of Thais in a place,  u know u are in for a real taste.
author: Mary J.

description: Awesome authentic Thai food with the best service!! Would highly recommend this place to anyone that wants a welcoming and delicious experience!! Five stars all the way.
author: Perm H.

description:
I've been going to this place for four days in a row now. Since I tried the food here I just keep craving it! The laab isn't like I'm used to, but it's really good! So far the laab and the chicken soup were the best. Maybe I'll post more after I've tried more.
EDIT: if you order for pickup, they don't start cooking your food until you arrive to pick it up. And the restaurant wasn't packed. Waited 20 minutes longer than my confirmed pickup time!DON'T USE EAT 24 to order! Minus 1 star
author: Lynn M.

description:
Saap Ver, Authentic Fly Cuisine

Bottom line up front - they have not figured out the lunch rush yet. The service was terribly confused, the appetizer was missed, the main courses had a ~10-15 minute delta between arriving amongst the group, there were flies EVERYWHERE, and the pad thai was cold.

Service
- It took 10 minutes to flag someone down to request a table
- Another 10 minutes went by, so we got up to flag down a different person who took our order
- We ordered very basic dishes: Egg rolls for the table, 2 soups, 1 pad thai
- It took another 20 minutes to get our food (we are roughly 40 minutes invested prior to food)
- They brought the two soups, 10-15 minutes later they brought the pad thai
- The egg rolls never came, after we inquired, they brought over a small plate of a cold egg roll that was cut in half (there were three of us, this clearly wasn't the table portion)
- We requested the spice rack, it never came
- We shared two napkins amongst the three of us

Food
- The soups were decent
- The pad thai was cold, lacked flavor, and had zero spice (and because the spice rack never came, it remained unspicy)
- The egg roll was terrible, after one bite no one wanted the other half

Closing service
- We stood up again to go hand someone the credit card to close out the bill
- They took off the "egg roll appetizer"
- They instantly cleared our plates off the table to ensure space for the next set of unlucky victims

This was our go-to lunch spot (team of ~60 employees) - will most likely give it another chance, but in the meantime, I'm referring to this place as "The Flytrap".
author: Jason M.

description: Ehhhh ... the food itself is pretty decent. Tastiness is in the 3.5 to 4 star range; however, I'm knocking the review down to a 3 because of all the flies. Regardless of time of year there's always a ton of flies that you have to shoo away from your plate. Really kills the enjoyment of eating at a restaurant.
author: Neil X.

description: The food here is ok. The only reason I come here is because it is close to my work. I have never experienced such horrible service in my entire life.  I tried coming here again to see if maybe if was a fluke but they were even ruder the second time.  I highly recommend eating anywhere else unless you are literally dying of hunger.
author: Kj M.

description: Haven't had authentic flavors like this outside of Pok Pok. They have a lot of dishes that most Americanized Thai places don't serve, and they don't skimp on the spice and the flavors. The space is rather large, and was great for a birthday dinner as well.
author: Kazu O.

description:
I love the food here. The menu is varied and unique. The dishes are tasty and spicy. And the unique decor and atmosphere makes me forget I'm in San Francisco for a while. Since our first visit I've been recommending them to everyone I know. But tonight's visit may be our last. 

There are gnats. Everywhere. They must find the food as declcious as we do because I have to keep swatting them away. I was able to forgive this to some extent on our first and second visit, until I went into the restroom. It was swarming with them. It was disgusting, and disappointing. We decided to get our dessert somewhere else.

I hope they can solve this problem. The place has some real potential. But until they address the bugs (which might be reflective of a larger issue), I won't be returning, nor recommending them to anyone else.
author: Elvis M.

description:
Other than the amazing Thai retro decor, this place left little to be desired.

This place just does not compare to the wonderfully delicious street food of Thailand as it proclaims.

The pad thai omelette sounded fun and unique but didn't taste any better than the standard pad thai you can get at any restaurant.

The only tasty thing about the Chiang Mai style pork with pork dip were the sauce and the chips. The pork was little pieces of overcooked, dry, and tough pieces of meat. Definitely not worth the $25 price tag. They just spread out the food on a large plate so that it seems like a lot of food but it's really just a little bit of pork.

The crab green papaya salad had zero crab meat along with a few one inch long miniature crab legs that can't be eaten. It was probably 1.5 cups of papaya salad with some dressing on it. Horrible.

The crispy duck salad was actually tasty but barely had any duck in it.

Server was friendly but pretty clueless. 

Bye! Won't be back again!
author: Catherine C.

description:
Decent food, attentive servers, great hours and super fun decor. I ordered take out, my veggies were literally raw! the curry base was delicious, but my carrots were hard and crunchy, I only got 1 potato in my yellow curry, and the eggplant was not even warm; it was completely RAW and hard! I thought it was a nice gesture to give me some fish cakes on the house (too fishy for me, didn't taste fresh) at least they tried and for that they get additional star. 

Unfortunately I was already 3 miles away back at work by the time I realized all these issues, so it was too late to have it corrected. I would give them another chance for dine in only.
author: Anna P.

description:
Stunned.

When you are in SOMA, and a place is simultaneously trendy, delicious, and affordable, you have to pinch yourself a little bit. Service was also impeccable - sweet, thoughtful, attentive. Plotting already to take all my friends here.
author: Janett R.

description: I can walk into this place and they immediately know what type of curry (pumpkin) wine (red, and dry) and spice level (thai hot). The food is always delicious, and staff friendly. I would consider this one of the best thai places I have been top up here, and they don't overload with sugar (more authentic)
author: Jackie B.

description:
Food is excellent

Ambiance is very pleasant and tasteful

Service is the worst I've ever experienced in my entire life. 4 out of 4 times I've visited they have forgotten at least 1 order and we wait between 20-45 minutes extra.

This most recent experience was the final straw and I won't be returning.
author: Andrew D.

description: Stopped by Saap Ver for dinner with friends. The service is good, wait-staff attentive... though it can take a little longer when the place is packed.... which is understandable. The dishes are flavorful and not too salty. We ordered the salted wings which, IMO, is wings & drums chopped in half (so, pieces are smaller), seasoned with salt & pepper, then deep fried. It's served with a sweet chili sauce. Main course were eggplant basil with calamari, a penang curry chicken, pad siu with prawn and pad thai with beef. Thai ice tea is not very sweet. The place can get a little noisy, but a very positive atmosphere overall. Personally, I like the movie poster plastered walls and the art theme used throughout, including menu. Overall, Saap Ver is one of the better Thai restaurants I've been to in the bay area. I'll definitely go back with more friends!
author: Cris L.

description: The crowd inside here looked really promising when we showed up.  I was totally expecting some quiet, sterile Asian place with few customers and mostly delivery orders.  Instead, what I found was a  facility where considerable thought went into the whimsical decor and a festive mood.  Unfortunately, the service left much to be desired.  Not only did the food come out incredibly slowly, but our waitress was way too hurried about her job.  Instead f taking time to ask if we needed anything each time she came by, she would come take plates away or set them down and within milliseconds run off again.  The food was decent, but not decent enough to wait so long to get it.
author: Ash T.

description:
Fun decor. Good for groups. Attentive staff.

Food: Meh. 
Crispy fried duck in basil was a salt bomb and was 60/70% duck fat and not duck meat. (and it was anything but crispy).

Tamarind Veggies. Didn't taste the tamarind at all. 

I've had street food in Thailand....doesn't compare.
author: Nancy G.

description:
Retro Thai movie posters adorn the walls and menus achieve an ambience of not taking themselves too seriously.  While the menu is quite extensive, the result is that the handful of "good" dishes are hidden among a selection of mediocre entries.
* Salt-grilled whole fish - fish was cooked well, and the accompaniment of sauces added a lot of flavor.
* Salted wings - they split the flats to make them easier to eat.  Decent option if you prefer extra crisp wings.
* Crying tiger - was cooked really tender and flavorful, but seemed a bit spendy compared to the other dishes
* Crab fried rice - ok dish, not a ton of crab but enough to impart flavor
* Basil chicken - meh, not very basilly, so it missed on the premise

While they were pretty busy on a Saturday night (there were multiple rowdy birthday groups), there were lengthy gaps where we were left looking for staff to no avail.  To echo many of the other reviewers, we found small flies in some of our drinks as well.
author: Lee S.

description: We've been here to eat three times now and am not sure how this restaurant gets its great reviews quite frankly. While the space has a cool vibe, the thai food is average to good, small portioned (relative to other Thai places). On top of that, the service was awful all three times we've been there -- where we had to stand at the front for a *long* time to get seated, then another 20 minutes for a server to come, then another 20+ minutes for the food to arrive, which arrived lukewarm. And during the meals couldn't get the server's attention during the meal for drinks, etc. *And* then the last time we were there, they were extremely rude to us after we paid the bill -- we're guessing for *only* tipping 24% on the pre-tax amount (the suggested amounts on the check were post-tax, and started at 18%....).  We tried to eat here a 4th time (it's the only Thai in our area so...) and they ignored us completely as we stood at the front -- even went up to a server and they said "yes" we'll be right with you, just sit down" -- and no one came to serve us (20+ minutes) and then it was closing time....they *never* came to even check on us -- just ignored us so we would leave. We'll be taking our business, and our positive recommendations, elsewhere now.
author: Kate A.

description: Had a nice time at a private wedding reception here last week. I had never been and don't eat s whole lot of Tai Food, so wasn't sure what to expect. All in all it was great. Staff was friendly, drinks from the bar were good too. As for the food, I thought it was great. Of course I didn't personally like everything that was served, but that's expected with my elementary food palette. Some dark colored noodles were great, seafood fried rice was great. The rib eye dish was my favorite for sure. I would totally go back if I'm ever in the area again. Nice location, the restaurant itself is very clean and well decorated. And just to make note because of all the mentions of flies in other reviews.. I didn't see one fly in the four hours I was there eating and partying.
author: Nick P.

description: The reason for the 1 star is purely for the terrible service. Not once, but twice. I went several months ago and was not acknowledged for 15 minutes while the restaurant was empty and had 3 tables busy only. I let them know that I was displeased with the service and left. The second time I walked in and told the waitress that we were a table for 3. There were at least 10 tables empty and she rudely said "I need to set up a table first." I agreed and stood waiting for her to set up a table, she asked me to stand by the bar in a rude way when I should have been seated by then. To sum it up, decent thai food but terrible service so I wont be going there again.
author: Hassan B.

description: The only thing positive about the experience was the food... which took an hour... for two people. We came in, were seated, and ignored. The table next to us was seated after us, but the server went to them first, and never checked in with us after we ordered. After one hour we asked about our food- she did not come back. Someone else dropped the first plate to us without saying anything- second plate came 10 minutes later after first plate was cold. When we asked for the bill we were charged for an item we did not order. No manager came to follow up. Won't eat here again.. all of this could easily have been remedied by a little bit of communication instead of ignoring us.
author: Laura M.

description:
Our friend had her birthday dinner here. 
First time coming here once you walked in its like vintage, feels like your in Thailand even though I never been to Thailand but the employees are  dressed, and the place , movies in Thai. Easy to find parking. The food was just okie I would really crave the food and come back. We had thai friends so they say this is really authentic thai food like lots of fish sauce and you can really smell it. The.only thing I didn't like was omg the flies was everywhere I think their are little small fruit flies everywhere and in their bathroom had them flying all over the place.

This place is very authentic thai if you really want to try real thai food come try this place .
author: Hoa T.

description:
You know how everyone raves about their {insert older family member here}'s cooking and how nothing...just NOTHING tastes the same? Well this place does it for me.

My dad is actually a Thai chef. I'm Thai. Mom's Thai. Whole family is Thai. I've spent a very very large part of my life in Thailand and basically only ever knew my family's Thai cooking.
Nothing has ever impressed me or been close to this level of Thai cooking until Saap Ver.
They do not hold back with the spices or vibrant flavor. Even their Pad Thai dish is as close to my dad's as I have ever had (he owned a Thai restaurant in New Orleans)  ---not that sweet style and mysterious orange color that Thai places like to serve to "Americanize" it.

What really intrigued me was their Nam Phrik sets. You don't really see this style of Thai cuisine in the states and I was dying to know if it tasted like my grandmother's. Not completely but pretty damn close and that's still saying a lot. 
I'm still working through the menu but I can proudly say I've accomplished a good chunk of it and I'll be gladly going back for more.

The ambiance is fun, the staff is friendly and if you look around, there are a shit ton of Thai people eating here.
Saap Ver, I hope you stick around so the next time my mom visits I can show you off to her and she is comforted by the idea that her daughter has not traded in her heritage for organic quinoa salads and $11 green smoothies.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Sometimes, you just need a solid, non-pretentious place to get good hot spicy food and a strong tropical-tinged cocktail.  Saap Ver delivers.

More fun atmosphere and slightly better food than it's predecessor Grand Poh Bah.  Service isn't perfect but they just opened.  Show them some patience and they will get you all taken care of.
author: Troy S.

description: I had the Tom Yum Goong. The shrimp seemed infected as there were tons of white spots usually meaning it's low quality and could get you sick. Low and behold, I was sick for several days with the chills and flu shortly after. At $18 plus tax for a bowl of soup, you'd think they use fresher ingredients.
author: Fan T.

description:
OUTRAGEOUSLY GOOD.

I've tried several items on the menu and have been blown away every single time. You know how there are some places that are so memorable because they redefined that type of cuisine for you? Saap Ver is that restaurant for me. I think it ranks within my top 5 favorite restaurants *ever*. 

I recommend the larb fish salad, grilled pork neck, spare rib soup, any of the noodles, and any dish that comes with pork belly. All of the dishes are really well-presented and look beautiful. Even the sticky rice came in a - for lack of a better description - cool-looking gold bowl. 

As others have said, this place has great decor and a trendy/casual vibe. Their bar was full the last time I went, so perhaps their drinks are good too. Workers are friendly and give great suggestions. I can't wait to introduce friends to this so I can eat here again and again and again....
author: Melody Y.

description: Closest taste to being in Thailand, pretty authentic. Good flavor, nice ambiance, really cool decorations, Old Thai movie posters n stuff. Only complaint is food takes long to arrive, they have alot of take out orders. Also price is kinda high, but somewhat appropriate for the area. Service is js pretty good. Definitely worth a try if u love authentic Thai
author: Sammy D.

description:
4.5 stars.  Good place for Thai food.  Everything here is full of flavor; but my wife says its full of flavor because it is full of MSG!  Lol.  I don't know - but it is great here either way.

Many of the reviews point out that this place is one for Thai street food, and they are right on.  But what makes them great is that they have a great knack for mixing the salty, sour, smokey, and spicy, while controlling for the temperature and appearance of the food.  If you eat a lot of Thai food, you know that a lot of the best restaurants don't necessarily have the best looking dishes.  This place can do both.

They also have a swanky looking bar (once they redid the place), and the place is definitely arranged for it to be casual looking and fun.  Good place for large parties

My wife is probably right though that they use a lot of MSG.  Both of us were pretty sleepy afterwards.  LOL.
author: Mark M.

description: Last time was supposed to be my last time already but a friend dragged me there.. we ordered a rice plate asking if it was spicy; they assure us that it was not spicy at all. Impossible to eat and didn't want to change it. I pass on the fact they haven't check on us once or not even a smile to welcome us. The tips were already included. I won't be back and I recommend you to not lose your time or money there.
author: Morgane M.

description: Came here with a group (there were 6 of us) on a Sunday afternoon before their grand opening. The food was great - all of the dishes were flavorful. The curry was so good that we had to order another portion, and we pretty much cleaned off everything on the plate for our papaya salad. But, the service was slow, perhaps because they were new. I'll give it a few more weeks before they get up to speed, but I'll be back again soon.
author: Ada C.

description:
A big resounding MEH. Been here twice now, each time the food was underwhelming. The crispy rice salad and the pumpkin curry with pork (which doesn't come with rice) were the best things we had. Pad see yew, papaya salad (served with a large wedge of cabbage to make the plate look fuller), and the drinks (mimosa and sangria) weren't particularly noteworthy.

Cute, large space. Service was fine for us.
author: Charlene C.

description:
One of my friend's Thai coworkers recommended this place and it definitely didn't disappoint. The inside is decorated like a Thai beach hut, but it was quite dark. The food was amazing! We had papaya salad, a stir fry, pad see ew and the sticky rice desserts. Everything was so good. I usually get just below Thai spicy at Thai restaurants, but my friend wanted mild this time and it was still SO spicy. They have a bunch of punch bowls for drinks and they were really yummy (though very strong). 

The prices were also very reasonable so...would definitely come back again!
author: Susie C.

description:
Pok Pok? Why do I have to go all the way to Portland, or LA for this kind of Thai culinary experience?  

For those who've visited Thailand, this place is as good as it gets when it comes to recreating the street food dining atmosphere. Chef Kobe does a great job changing up the offerings to present these new-to-Americans-but-familiar-to-Thai flavors to San Francisco and I love it. 

NOTE: If you think your experience Pad See Ewe, Pad Thai or anything curry makes you an expert in Thai food, then this place is probably too advanced for you.

ALL of the sauces are on point! I highly recommend anything that requires dipping, because these sauces are LEGIT. 

I wasn't too big of a fan of the Som Tum/Papaya Salad though....Everything else was BOMB.
author: Tim T.

description:
I was there with four people in the party with my 4 years old daughter. Our party was charged automatically 18% service charge on our bill. Without any notice or warning we almost paid extra tip on our credit card slip. So be careful on your visit!
We were there at 12 o'clock! It was quite busy! We had to wait for a while on the waiters to take order, bring us the water and food. We understand that the restaurant was quite busy though! But all the waiters seem so rush and busy! The food was about average not bad but not good! We loved some of the dishes we ordered. I really liked crispy rice salad(but we found the hair on it) I would like to suggest the owner to tell the chef to wear the hut, so the cab percent the contaminated! 
The decoration was very unique! I really enjoy the decoration there.
Service 3
Food 3
Ambiance 5
Overall I will rate this place 3.5
author: Andy P.

description:
Had an Uber Eat coupon so decided to order from Saap Ver Aunthentic. 
Things we ordered:
Drunken Noodles - Had great flavor and noodles were cooked well but was a tad bit oily. I would order again
Papaya Shrimp Salad - Because I love spicy food I wrote in the notes Spicy! and they most definitely made it spicy so if you don't like spicy beware but if you do this may be the spot for you!
Tom Yum Noodles Soup - Overall great flavor but once again on the oily side. 

I would most definitely come here again! Cant wait to actually come in a sit down to eat!
author: Eileen H.

description:
Been on the hunt for these dishes and flavors since our Thailand trip a year ago. I still love Ler Ros, but it's not the same.

Thai Iced Tea -- alls that's missing is drinking it from a plastic bag
Crab Papaya Salad -- a little bit of crab, but lots of crab flavor. The slow, creeps-up-on-you kind of spice (which is both fun and terrifying)
Crispy pork belly with sweet basil -- SO GOOD
Chicken Larb -- good but not amazing, don't think I would order this again.
Duck noodle soup -- good, not outstanding, would order again

On my list to try next time: whole fried fish, and khao soi (didn't see it on the menu, but the waiter said they had it)

It's definitely not the cheapest Thai in the city, but would come back for the authentic food. Also, got a warm, fuzzy feeling in our hearts when our waiter commented that we ordered dishes like Thai people. Awwwwww.
author: Julia C.

description: We went the day before the grand opening. There were 5 of us. We ordered a lot of variety of dishes so we could try many different things. 2 types of Somtum, Chiang Mai Style Pork Dip w/ Fried Pork, Thai Sausage Fried Rice, Tod Mun Pla, and several other dishes I can't remember anymore. We had a very good meal and left extremely full and happy.
author: Alison S.

description: Great place. Service was a bit slow but food was great. Good quality and quantity dishes. I will definitely go back when in the area.
author: Natalia M.

description: I was so excited to try this place.  There's nothing better in the world than great Lao food.  I walked in to the coolest ambiance ever with vibrant posters and music and was elated to have it all topped off with special Lao dishes.  But alas, it wasn't meant to be.  The food was too sour, the vegetables too scarce, and the food just too overpriced for what it was.  I was also told that I'd be charged $8 for a side of chili dip.  No, thanks. Still hanging on to the hope that more Lao food will make appearances in SF.
author: Ene S.

description:
Over priced- I would agree with the pricing of this restaurant if the chef was actually present. 

Staff communication - while they are the sweetest as in Thailand, our waitress in particular was still learning on the job and English was a challenge for her. Wait time can lag, be prepared to flag the staff down.

Ambience - cute, retro, Thai Lakorn/movie posters line the walls. Full bar.

Boat Noodle - Came here for the authentic boat noodle image shared on Yelp only to be served pork noodle soup base with beef; not boat noodle.

Papaya Salad - on point.

Seafood stir-fry - a combinatiom of seafood clams and bell peppers were on point but $20 for the dish makes me second guess my decision to dine there.
author: Miss E.

description: Kinda a nice lunch spot if you're in the area.  A few specials come with a soup and side.  A bowl of chili chicken actually had some heat to it!  TVs on display oddly playing daytime tele (why not run old thai moves from the 60s? but ok). A little chaotic with the service but ya, tasty, no doubt.
author: David S.

description: My favorite Thai food in San Francisco. Zappver means overly delicious in Thai and They are really overly delicious! Authentic Thai dishes are serving make me feel like I'm in Thailand plus cool Thai vintage decoration theme
author: Ten S.

description:
I'm updating my review because Saap Vee has improved their previously awful health score such that I am now willing to try it.  I ordered four dishes for take-out, the chicken and rice (I give it a 3.5 to 4- the sauce was spicy, even tho I ordered mild, and very flavorful but the chicken was so-so); squid salad (unusual and very good, the squid was plump and seemed quite fresh); pork salad(very good); Pad Thai with tofu (different, tasty, but just tofu - which was fluffy and flavorful- and noodles).

Good enough to keep exploring the menu!


I was looking forward to trying this place because it's on my way home from work - until I saw the HEALTH SCORE: 78. 

I'm in public health and will not eat anywhere with a score below 80 because that means there's some serious violation.

Come on people - clean it up!
author: R. P.

description:
I visited this restaurant after a friend told me about it. The place is too loud and their menu is not very user friendly. It's a thin booklet without any pictures the food. I asked the waiter for a recommendation and he suggested the chef's special "salted fish". It was a terrible choice as the fish was too salted and there was very little to eat out of it. I also ordered a coconut based soup and its presentation was pretty bad, it was hard to scoop the soup out of the bowl. 
Not to mention the place is pretty expensive. Soup and entree for $50? Definitely not returning to this place again.
author: Axl r.

description: They actually have excellent Thai food. Much much much better than other SF options. We mostly order to go, but the vibe of the restaurant is fun and boisterous and the bar makes solid cocktails. Warning: there are some authentic components to a lot of these dishes, so if you don't like spicy or the occasional vegetable you don't normally see in American Thai food, you might be a bit surprised.
author: Amjad S.

description:
This is a great restaurant.  My first dinner was with a buddy and two Thai women who lived the bulk of their life in Thailand and have been in America for a few years.  While my buddy and I were talking they were eating.  And eating.  They are not big women, both are petite. And they said it was the best Thai food they ever had!  Not just in San Francisco, or California, but anywhere.  

I'm not a spicy palate person so my favorites, grilled pork, pineapple fried rice, and Thai iced tea probably don't catch the foodies reading this.  But, I love durian (the stinky fruit) and Saap Ver is the only Thai restaurant I've been to in the states that has durian on the menu.  It is served in a sauce over black sticky rice and the durian flavors (if you can get past the smell  fresh durian tastes of peach, strawberry, apple, mango and citrus), while not quite as winning as fresh durian, are wonderful.

The Thai ladies liked the food because it reminded them of the street foods of Bangkok and Isan.  They loved the spicy papaya salad, and everything else.  I've never had a complaint about the service, price, or quality of the meal, I go there often.  It's a wonderful addition to the world of reasonably priced great food in San Francisco.
author: Jesse T.

description: Sign on the door says it opens at 11, however they didn't let us in till 1130. Ordered soup as an appetizer and it didn't come till way after the main dish. The pad see ew was subpar. Wouldn't return again.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Amazing food! My Thai friend took me here and he said it reminded me of Thailand. 

We stuck with basics. Chicken and rice for him, roast duck and rice for me, and Thai sausage to share. The Thai sausage was a little bit salty (get your mind out of the gutter ;) ) but it went well with the palate cleansing vegetables and jalapeños and lime on the side.
The roast duck was well cooked and super moist. Good balance of fat as well.

Thai tea was off the hook and my friend got a coconut ice cream (served in a coconut) which was a little too sweet but overall good. 

Would definitely come back for more!
author: Wilson T.

description:
New Thai spot serving dishes true to its roots. The pad thai comes wrapped with an omelette, just like they do in Bangkok Chinatown. Their rice ball salad is even better than my previous favorite at Champa Garden. Can't wait to try more of their dishes. 

They have a full bar, and the spicy cocktail I had was very nice. The decor is pretty awesome, with a movie theatre theme. Happy hour menu is served all day!
author: Derrick V.

description: This place is the best Thai food I've had in the city! Authentic, spicy and full of flavor. To top it all off the ambience is really upbeat and fun! This is perfect Friday or Saturday night spot to go out for drinks and delicious food.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Pad Thai way too sweet
Roasted duck over rice ok, very plain
Tom yum noodle soup good
Cool decor
Nice service
Papaya salad was good
Shrimp rolls pretty good
author: Jones T.

description:
Yummy Thai food, good size portions, fair prices.

Very fun atmosphere with old classic Thai movie posters on the walls.
author: Robert M.

description:
Sitting in Saap Ver really transports you to Thailand--the decor is vibrant and creative, and the food is authentic as promised.

I was really impressed with the attention to detail in general...the menu is deep and well designed, and the dishes are served with fragrant fresh spices. 

Add in the reasonable prices and spacious dining room, and I'll absolutely be returning.
author: David Z.

description: Wow. The food here is really good. I ordered delivery from here via uber eats. I tried the spicy chang mai sausage, the pad prik king green beans with pork and some steamed rice. The highlight for me was the sausage the flavors accented each other so perfectly I just wish it was larger! The green beans were cooked to my liking I cannot stand when a restaurant over cooks veggies and they become soft. anyways this was my first time eating from here and I will definitely eat here again.
author: J B.

description: Do not sit at the corner table. Took 10 min to receive a menu. Ordered, and 30 min later, waitress came to retake our order. Four tables arrived after us and received their food before we left with empty stomachs. An hour and ten minutes of waiting. The water was good.
author: Jocelyn C.

description:
Omg this is so much better than I expected.

I like Thai food. Real Thai food, the spicy sour pungent stuff that sings of lemongrass and galangal, of lime and chili, cascading over the tongue with torrents of flavors. In other words, not pad Thai. That said I don't expect to get really good Thai food most of the time. 

I came into this restaurant and saw them advertising northeastern Thai food, otherwise known as isaan or e-San food, which is more like Lao cuisine than traditional Thai. I was stoked, and decided to go out on a limb, asking the waitress to recommend good e-San fare. I got a pork rib soup that was truly superb: spicy, sour, fragrant, with ribs soft and falling off the bone. 

I also wanted papaya salad after seeing the yelp pics of mortar and pestle. Sure enough they have three or four kinds of som tum, which is rare at sit down restaurants but common if you're really making it fresh. Without hesitation I ordered the salted crab version, which is super pungent from the fish sauce and the fermented crab legs. Yes, they are black. Yes, they make the dish that much more delicious. It was fantastic as expected. (Pro tip guys in most Asian cuisines anything fermented is what you can call "authentic" in your yelp review.)

And the wait staff is so so nice in the way that only Thais can be. Yes there were some longer waits at times but when the people are so sweet, and the food is so flipping good, well, you just smile back and feel oh so happy inside.
author: Nick R.

description: Really yummy food. Really cold service. Make sure you order that second glass of wine before closing time. We had a big group and a table full of just-delivered food at closing but they did not serve drinks, replenish water, or offer dessert for a 9 person birthday dinner party after the 10pm close time, even though they accepted a 9pm reservation.  Waiter was too busy washing the floor to bring the check.  I'll still go back (seriously the food is good) but it's better if you pretend they close at 9:30. Authentic Thai food but no authentic Thai hospitality.
author: Saana B.

description: The food was GREAT! The services was lacking. Two cokes were ordered, one coke and not-so-cold water was delivered. One of two appetizers showed up. Then one of two entrees showed up. Then #2 entree was delivered about 15 minutes later without the appetizer. We were checked on once. The staff seemed to pay us no mind. They were pleasant though.
author: Douglas R.

description: I have never been made angry by a restaurant but this place did the trick. An hour and a half after we had ordered the food it finally gets to us, and it's completely the wrong meals. The receipt on the outside of the bag was correct so this was a mistake made by the restaurant. I called the restaurant and the guy on the line tried to immediately blame it on the Uber driver. Afterwards he said well, there's nothing I can do you have to contact Uber. The food we got was much less, super basic, and contained shrimp which I'm allergic too. So not only did they mess up, they didn't apologize and they didn't find any way to fix their mistake. To top it off, the little food I could eat was horrible. The soup tasted like it was made from dirty dish water.
author: Nadja K.

description:
Just came from Thailand and the food here tastes just as good as the food I ate there. 

I recommend the Kra Pow Gai and Pork belly Pad See Ew.
author: Nino P.

description: Just had the most underwhelming hainanese chicken rice. Absolutely bland chicken, obviously unseasoned, super dry, and with sauce that has too much of a kick that kills the remaining flavor of the chicken. Never order this.
author: G C.

description:
I wanted so much to like this place.
