After Grand Pu Ba (previous Thai restaurant), I hoped this place was gonna be better. Not sure if it's the same owners and they just rebranded, but the service is about the same. Slow. There were maybe 3-4 tables total and our food took more than 40 minutes to come out. 

The food wasn't very good either but maybe we didn't order the right things. We ordered from their "happy hour" menu - thought it'd be a good deal for $5/plate: chicken wings and fish cakes. The wings are not your typical wings! Imagine your normal wings cut in half. There were maybe 2 of those (so one wing total?) and then maybe 4 pieces of that sharp part that usually gets chopped off (cartilage? No meat on it). So all-in-all, maybe about 2.5-3 wings worth of meat. No significant flavor. Just fried, salt and pepper. Blah. Fish cake was decent, good flavor mix, but think it was store-bought. Blah. We also went for the Pad Thai, a good dish to test for comparison of other Thai restaurants. The shrimp was way overcooked and the noodles were as chewy as rubber bands. Blah. 

Ended up being less than $25 but it was totally unsatisfying. I think I'll give this one more chance since the other reviews made it sound so incredible. If I don't change the rating from 2 stars, I didn't enjoy it the second time.
author: Cookie M.

description: We did a takeout. The food is very good, by far very authentic. Super happy with Tom Yum Noodle - the best I ever had in the U.S. I'am also pumped with Salted Egg Som Tum because I never had any where else besides Thailand. If you want authentic Thai food experience, definitely check this place out. They nail it.
author: Nikki S.

description: First of all,  I tried to order online, but their website was down. Therefore, I phone in my order. Anyway, looks like their price went up when I picked up my order. I got a Sea Bass Clay Pot.  online is $20.00, and when I picked up it's $25.00 + fee, ended up $27.00. It's not what I was expecting to have. my order looks like a mess. No more ordering from this Thai restaurant for sure!!!!
author: Tiffany J.

description: Really different than most Thai joints. If I were in the northeast of Thailand, a place like Saap Ver would be there. Everything was delicious and authentic. I love the hustle and bustle too. I really cannot find one thing to nit pick about. I was truly in food heaven. This is the kind of place that even if you're full you want more. I recommend the bbq chicken w/stiky rice and a papaya salad. Also the duck plate. And of course mango and sticky rice for dessert. Exceptional. Standing ovation. Blowing kisses.
author: S. G.

description: Food was absolutely delicious. Presentation was elegant. Decor very unique Thai movies on the wall.
author: Sherwin W.

description: My coworkers and I had pad see ew with pork, eggplant stir fry tofu and shrimp vegetables stir fry lunch set.  Fresh Spring roll, chicken satay and soup.  All was very good.  My only complaint was I only got 3 shrimp for an up charge of $3 in a lunch set.  Even for lunch that seems like a very small portion.
author: Leah R.

description: We had the healthy spring roll(no fried) as appetizer. No any flavor but we think it tastes healthy. Yum soup noodles was awesome. I had it extra spicy and loved it very much. Pad Thai is a safe choice here, and as you may not, it won't wrong to get Pad Thai in a Thai food place.
author: Donna Z.

description: If you like it hot - order thai spicy!  Thai country style food that leaves a little sweat.  I had the clay pot sea bass and the larb salad.  Larb salad amongst the best I've had.  Sea bass good and would get again after I try a few more things.  Good street side seating as well.
author: P K.

description: Been here a few times now, and it's definitely a nice addition to the neighborhood.  The space is really interesting, while the food is hit or miss.  Both the pad cha scallop and the pad thai were kinda disappointing, but the tom yum goong and five spice pig leg were both really flavorful and delicious.  Will definitely keep coming back here to try the other interesting items on the menu.
author: Simon L.

description:
Yes! So stoked this showed up in the neighborhood. I was walking by and was immediately struck by the sign with Thai characters.  I know they replaced another Thai restaurant in the same spot, but that one looked kinda generic and I actually never tried it. 

The food at Saap Ver was super authentic. Crazy spicy and funky. I tried dishes I never see on most other Thai restaurants. Thai sausage salad with crispy rice and a dry noodle soup with pork and peanut (kuay tiew tom yum moo). Both were excellent. 

My only complaint was that it's in this weird strip mall-ish restaurant near the design center and was completely empty. They did just open recently so I'm hoping that'll change. I'll definitely be back tho.
author: Jason D.

description:
Ambiance is very cute and food was very tasty and eclectic. The menu was almost too big and it was hard for me to pick something because I was interested in so many items! I ordered for a large office lunch and the food was prepared quickly and still tasted great. 

While staff was very nice, they clearly are a little understaffed. For example, I had tried to call in my pick-up order but no one picked up the phone. Luckily, my office is close so I just popped by, but I hope they get better accustomed to the busy lunch hour or get more staffing.

I tried the crispy rice salad and loved it. We also ordered a bunch of apps and I thought the Fried Tofu and Spring Rolls were awesome. I would probably skip the Larb Wontons just because I liked the other apps better.

Overall, I'm a fan :)
author: Christina R.

description:
Ok , just finished the most amazing dinner at Saap Veer and i am in heaven! A must try people! Delicious, authentic( if you travelled to Thailand) and fresh!
Loved it!
author: Mircea M.

description:
Food is great, ambience is great, service needs work. 

The menu selection is more diverse than other thai places I have been to. You have your standard pad see ew's, curries, papaya salad, and tom yum noodle soup, but there were lots of other things I'd never seen, like fermented rice sausage, shrimp past fried rice, mixed fruit salad, etc.

Service was slow but it was due to clear understaffing. 2 servers with no bussers cannot handle a full restaurant on a Saturday night. Once they hire more people the bottlenecks should go way. One thing that bothered me was a women in the kitchen had her hair down and no hair net - big no no. It's literally a matter of time before a customer finds a hair in their food. 

I ordered the shrimp paste fried rice, as I love shrimp paste anything. It was delicious.

Prices are San Francisco prices. There's no point in fighting them anymore. They are here to stay. 

Will definitely be back - the ambience was too cozy and food too good not to, but hopefully the aforemnentioned kinks will be worked out soon or it may be hard to develop regulars.
author: Polly F.

description:
Okay I think an update is required. I probably might have went there on the wrong day and time. Today they had a manager who kept the food moving from the kitchen to the tables, so the service was much better than last time and also the guy who spilled water on my table wasn't there. 

I ordered yellow curry with rice and Thai ice tea. The quantity was good and I was very satisfied with my meal. The curry tasted good, not the best that I have tasted but still was better than most of the Thai places that calls themselves authentic.  The Thai ice tea tasted like thai ice tea. 

I was in and out within 30 mins and this time I got my soup of the day. Yay. I am definitely going back because there are so many things on the menu that I would like to try, though I will go there when its not too crowded.
author: Ankit A.

description:
I can't wait to go back and try other items. The service really needs work but 2 of our dishes were stand out delicious and 1 was what you would expect.
The SPICY CRISPY RICE SALAD - Thai Sausages, Mint, Ginger, Peanuts was spicy, tangy, crunchy and delicious. I would order that again in a heartbeat.  
The PAD SEE EW - Flat Rice Noodle, Chinese Broccoli, Egg, Soy Sauce was just what you would expect to get when ordering PAD SEE EW. Nothing special, sort of on the comfort food side. 
The PAD RED CHILI -House Made Red Chili Paste, Peppercorn, Galangal, Kaffir Lime with Chicken was also a wonderful treat. Spicy tender chicken bites ( a little on the oily side but it tasted so good, who cares ). Bite into the peppercorns for a little flavor explosion. 
There was no Singha the day we went. Boo! One must have Singha Beer when eating Thai food. 

It's a delightful addition to my neighborhood.
author: Cindy J.

description: SOLID 5 stars. You want a taste of legit Thai food come here. It was like heaven in my mouth. The thai sausage crispy rice was amazeballs.  Larb is always my go to and I was not mad at it! I am telling you, it tastes like the real Thai experience. A little $$$ but well worth it!
author: Jess C.

description: Went to the restaurant for the first time and instantly fell in love. The decor, music, service, everything indicates a truly authentic thai food place. Ordered the pad thai with duck, seafood sizzling plate and barbq chicken. The pad thai was delicious and the duck had a lovely crispy skin. I like thai chillies and can stand its heat, but if you are not much of a spicy food person, you might want to ask them to avoid a few chillies in the seafood sizzling.
author: Fatema M.

description: Great service! Crispy, delicious spring rolls. Medium spicy was a little too much for me, but still good. Definitely coming back!
author: Humaira A.

description: The food is good, and it's a nice option in an area that still doesn't have a lot of restaurants -- especially ones that are open on weekends.  The 2 stars is more for the service: the servers are always pleasant, but everytime I come here, the wait to get your food from the time you order is always too long (I was here two days ago and waited 25 mins. before my food came, and it was just the lunch special!).  I always, always have to flag someone down to get them to take my order, bring my check, or even refill my water glass.  I've tried coming here on a weekend, weekday, lunchtime, dinnertime, and they always seem understaffed, so I'm not sure why it's an ongoing issue.  Too bad -- with the amount of housing that's being built in the area, they'll just get even more crowded (with any luck), so it'll be interesting to see if they survive or if people get fed up with waiting and just leave (something I've seen happen on more than once occasion here).
author: Carlo A.

description: 4 stars for the ambiance and the crispy prawn rolls.  Really like the decor here, a lot of effort went into it.  The shrimp here is large and fresh in all the dishes we tried. The Pineapple fried rice was ok. The service could've been a bit better, but for lunch time it was decent, no complaints like others had about dinner. The bathrooms are spacious but could be cleaned better. Will be back to try out the attractive happy hour specials.
author: Jon L.

description: Great authentic Thai food, atmosphere is old time movie. Terrific whiskey selections, even have Yamazaki 12 & 18 year. Got to treat myself.
author: W K.

description:
So glad Saap Ver took over for Grand PuBah.  Authentic Thai is back in the hood!  Four different ways to prepare papaya salad?  Yes, please.  Liver in my soup?  Yes, please.  Po Tak is back on the menu.  Yes, please!!!

Can get crowded and loud at lunchtime, take out time for me.  I'll return for dinner and cocktails.
author: Ania B.

description:
I'm a good friend of SaapVer seeing this from the very beginning of all the process myself..., I love the effort of the small team they are trying to invent, cook, and serve their food & drink at best of everything. Please come try their great food at SaapVer, they're still working on an awesome Bar idea. I can't wait for the grand opening event to come, just take your time and we will support you guys like this forever...., 

Just come out Enjoy & Have fun with them at SaapVer...!!!
author: Nop P.

description:
Hi Yelpers, 

I highly recommend this place. Outstanding food, beautiful decorations, friendly staff -- overall great place for a good time! 

Enjoy.
author: Andrew K.

description: The restaurant and bathroom was full of little flies. We didn't finish our meals. Disgusting !!
author: Falk G.

description: I really wanted to eat AUTHENTIC thai, so I thought I'd give this place a try based on reviews & photos. I thought it was pretty close given the lack of resources, but the effort to create true authenticity was bold! Menu was in English AND Thai (I prefer to order in Thai because I am more familiar with the actual Thai dish rather then the "American" translation) and typically anything you could order at a simple restaurant in Thailand, you could find it here. The food, "Saap", as I could tell the quality of the ingredients they use. Overall, I would definitely visit again when in town. If you ARE looking for a more modern concept, you probably won't find it here.
author: D K.

description: Food is extraordinary! The taste are very similar to homecooking in Thailand. No longer do I need to go to L.A. for an authentic style of Thai food. The ambiance is great. You can bring a date or your family amd you can't go wrong. The restaurant is great proximity to AT&T Park. It is a good place to get a drink at their full bar after the ballgame.
author: Eddy M.

description: Overrated food. Bad service.  Dined in at lunch time. It took a long time for the waiter to come by to take our order then they forgot our order. It took an hour to get our food. I had to get up to ask the waiter several times. They just kept saying in a few minutes. I saw they had many orders on their computer like from ubereats and other sources. Ours was forgotten. It was not even that crowded in the restaurant. They should have comped us for the inconvenience. They only gave us a couple of lousy ice teas and a 10% discount. We had to get our food to go by the time it arrived. The big downer was that my noodle dish was terrible. The noodles were overlooked and gooey. The meat was overlooked and chewy. They had left in the cartilage in the meat instead of taking it out so much of it was inedible. Small portions as well. Never going back again.
author: Robbie R.

description: this restaurant hosts illegal after hours parties with hundreds of people, including underage minors and prostitutes,  several nights a week after they close. they keep everyone awake with their fighting, screaming, drunken brawls and crazy loud music. they don't respond to any requests from their neighbors upstairs about the noise. i don't understand why they're still in business.
author: Pari A.

description: The food is good but not as good as other Thai places I have gone to. The only reason I come to this one is out of convenience.  The service here really sucks!!!!! They took forever to come and take our order then forgot something we ordered  then brought it 20 minutes later!! Then tried to charge us for the item!
author: Catherine F.

description: A gem of a place for authentic thai cuisine. I love their tom ka, red curry and fish cakes! Also has a full bar and is a fun spot. Try their homemade coconut icecream for a treat.
author: Heini V.

description:
Full of GNATS everywhere!

This is sooooo against health code! There were flies flying everywhere and landing on your food, there was no way you can eat without them being in or around. Maybe they should close the place and exterminate all them bugs first!

Service is very slow, and the wait staff does not seem take note on what you wanted to add or subtract from your meal.
author: Amy L.

description:
Flys, gross. They were everywhere, I definitely got an arm workout swatting then all away.

The food is solid when there aren't flies on it, or dead bugs in it. They can definitely kick the heat up and is a great spot if you love spicy food. Some of the dishes like the fish and rice salad had an overwhelming ginger taste to it.

The service was spotty, and our food took a long time to come out. We had to wait around 30 minutes for our food when the restaurant was half full and no explanation from the waitstaff.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Good food.
But horrible service. 

Watch out for flies in your food.  Found  flies almost 4 times in food. Got plates changed. Not food changed.  Never coming back
author: Bargain D.

description: I ordered take out and was greeted by Steven at the bar who was extremely kind!! He was incredibly knowledgeable about Thai food and the food was remarkable! Luckily I live across the street and will be back for more nom nom nom :)
author: Sara P.

description: This is my go-to Thai place. The food is the most authentic Thai I've tasted since a trip to Thailand years ago. Everything on the menu is tasty but my favorite is the drunken noodles. The place is cute too, and big, so you don't usually need a reservation ahead of time for 2-6 people. The drinks are great here too. Real fruit with liquor inside, etc.
author: H L.

description: Tried this new restaurant with my family. Great atmosphere, service, and food. We will definitely come here many times in the future. I highly recommend.
author: Mark E.

description: Super bland & overpriced for Chicken and Veggies.. Not even salt or pepper on the chicken to give it a little flavor. The only item with some flavor was the broth and that was probably not from the chicken they served. I will try again in case it was an off day but waiting 20 minutes for a lunch order is not great either.
author: tammy m.

description: Great thai food with a cool retro theme. The crispy chicken fried rice is really delicious.
author: Ian S.

description: Such a standout Thai restaurant. Delicious dishes you won't find at most places in SF. I was taken here by a Thai friend who says that the food is really authentic. Try the crab omlet, it has an amazing sauce. Pleasant and cute interior and friendly staff too!
author: Brian R.

description: Painfully slow. It took them 45 minutes to bring our appetizers despite repeated reminders. They are way understaffed.
author: Peter B.

description: Our waiter, Ryan was very accommodating to my party. The Hostess, Yok, was very friendly and greeted us right when we walked in.
author: Derek C.

description: I went to this place for lunch with 5 co-workers. The restaurant was not very busy when we arrived as 1/3 of the tables were empty. You might think you will get better service as the restaurant is not busy. Think again! The service was very low. We got there by 1:10PM and the food wasn't ready until 1:50PM. Also, the food was very disappointing. I ordered Roast Duck Over Rice and the dish is barely warm. Also, the roast duck has very strong propane taste. One of my co-worker ordered Garlic Pepper Pork, and she said the food was extremely salty. Other co-workers ordered fried rice and pat see ew, but they said their food were OK. I guess they do have something that is good, but I definitely do not have courage to give this place another chance. If you are going to give it a try, please avoid the yucky "propane duck over rice" and "salty pepper pork".
author: Kelly H.

description: Ordered through the Yelp app. Came and they hadn't even started making my order. Said five minutes but didn't give me priority. Took 40 minutes to get my food and the food was a small portion for the price and I got Togo and they didn't even give me a bag.
author: Solomon W.

description: My Favorite Thai food place in SF. One of my favorite dish is Thai style oyster, they have four kind source that go with the oyster, very interesting tasting. Coconut soup is a bomb! Chicken wings and cocktail shrimp are very nice too! Love here!
author: Rain H.

description: Finally, a legit Thai restaurant with some food country-style dishes you can't get from the other places. The fish larb is crispy, flavorful, and the closest thing (in SF) we've found to a dish we had in Phuket. Crying Tiger was delicious and cooked medium rare with a savory dipping sauce. Gonna have to go back for some of my other childhood favorites like Kao Mun Gai and boat noodle soup.
author: Nina L.

description: Lovely food, fun decor. But entirely too loud to talk. Decibel level at 80 even BEFORE the live music started. We had to give up talking and just eat, which is unpleasant.
author: Jane M.

description:
If I could rate half stars, I'd give Saap a 3.5. Ambience is cute, vintage, large big screen to watch sports games on, and parking is ample. Only negative on the physical space is that at the end of the night, they dimmed the room and I literally had to turn my iPhone flashlight on to see the food on my plate and finish out the meal.

Staff is really friendly and regardless of who your server is, if you catch anyone's attention, they will stop and assist you. The first time I went, the food service took incredibly long, twenty five minutes for the first app to arrive to table on a fairly slow night was frustrating. However, the food came fairly quickly on our second experience, so I was glad to see them work those service kinks out. 

On each occasion, I have been surprised at the flavors and layers of the delicious food, just a few hiccups on service and on a couple dishes that could make this place truly great. On my first experience, we ordered the pad Thai, crispy pork belly with basil, chicken satay, and tom kha. The pad thai was flavorful with just the right amount of sweet with the flavor of tamarind and savoriness. Ample shrimp and a surprising addition of a soft thin but fluffy omelet that covered the top. Almost like a Japanese omurice, but filled with pad thai instead! The tom kha was hands down the best tom kha I've ever had. Again, all flavors really well balanced with creamy coconut milk, spice, sweet, savory, and sour. I could not get enough. The only misstep with the soup is that they utilized random hacked chunks of chicken, which were hard to eat the meat off of, and left little shards of bone to pick out of every other spoonful. I imagine they have less waste and it may be more authentic to Thailand, as they are butchering the whole chicken versus utilizing the breast or drumsticks alone, however the velvety mouth feel of the soup was tainted by the shards of bone.  It was the equivalent of getting sand in your oyster or egg shell in your omelet. No matter how delicious it tastes, that one mistep can ruin the dish. Pork belly was decent, crispy skin, a few pieces were dry but the spicy soy and basil sauce made up for it. However on my second trip the pork belly was terrible. The skin was not crispy but so hard and chewy I had to spit it out, and the meat itself was terribly dry and fiberous. We asked the server to take this plate away, and she easily obliged. The winners of night were the pork neck salad and green curry filled with chicken and Thai eggplant. The pork neck salad is similar to the dish served at Ler Ros, however the lime and Thai chili sauce coats the luscious fatty pork neck and is covered with mint, Thai basil, and green onions, while the sauce is served on the side at Lers Ros. Both different, but equally delicious. A hands down favorite of mine.
author: jessica c.

description: Looks nice but bad service. Sat for 20 min and was completely ignored. Asked two passing waiters for service, but was still ignored. Wasn't even very busy.  Cant even properly rate it, never even got a drink. Bummer....smelled good.
author: Joshua G.

description:
This place has potential. Ambience is nice. 
1st try had Duck and Basil....excellent. Chicken flat noodle....excellent.  Service....HORRIBLE!
2nd try had pineapple fried rice...excellent.  The pork belly basil....good. The Seabass clay pot....HORRIBLE. 
Service......HORRIBLE AGAIN. 
Took forever to get order. Took forever to arrive, about 20 minutes for first dish. When we asked about Seabass ($20),  it arrived about 40 minutes later super bland and over boiled in claypot. The fish was rock hard. Showed our waiter and didn't eat it.
Finally the bill came and the waiter knew we were frustrated and said the best he could do was to discount 10% off the bill. ... $4.50!?! WOW. Next time take off the awful tasting seabass off the bill.
Then he finally refilled our water glass after being empty for 30 minutes.
THE SERVICE IS TERRIBLE!!!! TAKE THE SEABASS OFF THE MENU!!!!
author: Karma Is Coming 4 U.

description: Our office ordered lunch take-away. Every dish was surprisingly BLAND. We don't want to write off Saap Ver because they just opened and they've done a great job with the interior decor. Please tell the chef and cooking staff to add more flavor, garlic and spice. Thanks!
author: Greta K.

description:
Love this place
The duck and the eggplant stuff with shrimp is so good
We like it with green curry
author: R K.

description: Thai rice sausage and laarb fish (??) were really good. Much prefer to Ler Ros as I feel the food here feels more current and reminds me of what you'd find in more up market cafes in BKK. Also think the flavours here are more complex, bold and yet well balanced compared to Farmhouse.
author: Joanna Y.

description: We came tonight for the soft opening and were blown away. The ambiance, the food, the bar - all exceeded expectations...and this is just the soft opening! Can't wait to come back often!
author: Carrie W.

description:
I went to get a massage at Suchada and thought how convenient this would be to go eat at Saap Ver. I was a big fan of Gran Pu Bah ( previous place) and thought to give it a try. 

Well, things did not turned has planned. The food was absolutely infect! 
First of all, the menu was small and did not offer much choices. They have a big kitchen so I am not sure why they decided to make such a small menu. So I ordered an appetizer, which was tasteless and horribly fried. Then ordered the tom ka gai soup. It is usually my ultimate favorite and you can tell if the place is authentic. Well what I found inside made me want to vomit... The chicken pieces were chopped with bones and nerves. Obviously impossible to eat. It was looking disgusting and thought to myself what kind of chef would serve a soup like that! I was even afraid to try the soup itself without the chicken thinking that it could get me food poisoning. So I threw it away. Spent $12 for nothing. 
Then got the chicken basil dish with the fried egg. Tasted mediocre, greasy. They grinned the chicken so you are not even sure what you are really eating....

I usually don't leave bad review but the food there is not good. 

In my opinion, this is just a place where you can get a good drink, that's all.
author: Laetitia V.

description: This place is the best Thai restaurant that I've ever had in my whole entire life. I've been to many zagat rated Thai restaurants in the OC and LA and nothing beats this place. The service was amazing, we had a huge party and all of our parents are pretty picky but they also loved this place. I'll have to come back here whenever I'm visiting SF.
author: Khoi T.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco thus far. Their appetizers are okay but their main entrées are very authentic compared to all the Thai restaurants I've tried in the city. I highly recommend Ground Pork Tom Yum Noodles, Papaya Salad with Grilled Chicken and Sticky Rice Set, Chicken Thai Basil with Fried Egg, and Egg Wrapped Pad Thai.
author: Minnie S.

description: Maybe I came by on a bad day, but we came in on a Friday afternoon when it's not so busy, just 2 of us. We came in and no one came to seat us so we asked if we could sit and we're told it was cash only. The waiter had a difficult time understanding us the entire time. Their internet had gone out so it was cash only, we we went across the street to pull cash from an ATM. No one saw us to sit us down so we sat ourselves down. My friend was asking if the curry was part of the combo and the waiter didn't understand. Then she asked what the soup of the day was and it's just a clear broth with carrots about 1/2 cup. We got the entree, soup, and appetizer combo. Our appetizers came out and they are tiny. The fresh spring roll is 1/2 a roll. Tasty but small. Then our entrees came out but they had forgotten our soups so those came out after we asked for them. The soup is an extra $3 and not worth it for the size. Just save your money and order 2 entrees instead of the combo.
author: Crys L.

description: I can't say enough great things about this place. Such an amazing staff, drinks, and food. Came for their grand opening and there was live music (which apparently happens every Saturday) and tons of authentic Thai food... None of that "Asian/Thai fusion" ish. Can't wait to come back!
author: Nick V.

description: Love this place, if you looking for authentic Thai food, I do recommend this restaurant and please don't forget to ask for their special dish, they keep updating very often. Great food with good services and reasonable price
author: Damisa J.

description: Just really fresh tasting and excellent and authentic Thai food.  Very nice ambiance with new remodel, Thai movie theme.
author: Anibel B.

description: Was truly surprised by how good the food was.  Try the basil duck and clay pot SeaBass. Nonmnomnom!
author: Uri L.

description: They are open, for sure. Wanting a simple, healthy soup as i'm recovering from food poisoning, so I ordered Thai seaweed tofu soup. It was fantastic, and I bet it hardly ever gets ordered. The tofu was soft and fresh and the seaweed was delicious. Glass noodles complimented it nicely. Try it.
author: Michele H.

description: We got the larb fish, the spring rolls, the Thai rice sausages, and a giant pineapple cocktail.  All were really good!  The fish was our favorite.  Service was great.  A ton of interesting items on the menu.
author: James A.

description: This place is amazing. The crunchy salad with sausage is my favorite but seriously everything I've had is great. It is a bit spicy but in a perfect way.  So glad this opened so close to the house.  You must go here. I hate boring Thai food and this is definitely far from boring.
author: a g.

description: This was across-the-board mediocre.   The only element they've done successfully is the hip vibe.  We started with Deep-fried salted chicken "wings".  I use quotes because the meat had been cut away leaving a single bone deep-fried with minimal meat or taste.  Our other appetizer was fresh spring rolls about which one of my friends said they were they lamest he'd ever had.    The best entree was basic noodles with chicken which was flavorful but no better than a food truck.   The eggplant dish consisted of crunchy carrots and a small round green vegetable which had the taste & appearance of an uncooked green tomatillo, but they claimed was some eggplant.   Drowned in spicy red sauce, there was no flavor but spiciness.    The pork rice dish was a small amount of plain roast pork on white rice -- as boring as it sounds.    That was it.   The food arrival was shockingly slow and the service also sucked but no need to elaborate on that.   But hey - parking is easy.
author: James W.

description: We used to frequent the previous business and were very nicely surprised by the change! It had a friendlier more casual vibe change to the decor and ambiance. The food was much more authentic and was delicious. The staff was nice and attentive. Much more kid friendly than the previous restaurant. We really enjoyed our meal. Will certainly be back.
author: Mellissa B.

description: The best Thai restaurant in San Francisco! The food, the ambience, the service was outstanding. A must-eat-here experience.
author: Jimmie R.

description: It's such a cute restaurant. I've never seen anything like it . The way they decided to decorate it is very different but in a good way.  Think it adds a very good touch to the pretty authentic Thai menu. Nice and spacious with a bar as well, wasn't too hard to find parking but I think I got lucky. The food was really good, I felt like I was back at home with my mom or back in Thailand . The menu is pricey but I didn't mind, and the service was great to top it all off. Will definitely be coming back .
author: Jasmine K.

description: I was really please by how good the food was here! My friend who originally from Thailand suggested this place and told me that it was the most authentic Thai food restaurant in the city. I came here with no expectations but it was actually really amazing food! I will definitely come back here when I want to get some authentic tasting Thai food :-)
author: Jay S.

description:
We really wanted to like this place but it was just not meant to be.  We have been to this location many times before it became Saap Ver and the same issues seem to be recurring regardless of name and ownership, the service is atrocious and the food is not worth the wait.

We came on a Saturday night when you would think ownership would staff up.  Instead, the front of the house was complete chaos with only about 80% of the tables seated.

Wait staff had no clue who had which tables.  We were greeted and greeted again but with no follow up.  I watched another table order and wait about 20 minutes for their food to arrive.  Another gentleman had to go to the waitress and alert her that their table was ready to order.
The owner had to run back into the kitchen to help the cook.  The bartender had to come out and clean tables and take orders.  Sad to say this is why we never went back to the previous restaurant at this location.  

This place is a great space but the front of the house requires a lot of work.

The back of the house could use some help as well.  We wanted to order items we have not seen on other menus.  Boy, was that a mistake.

We ordered the fried tofu and meatballs.  Eating the fried tofu was like eating cardboard.  What it should be is crispy on the outside and soft and silky on the inside.  No texture except for the hard fried outer crust.

The meatballs were packaged meatballs.  I am willing to bet a meal that this is the case.  Ownership, please prove me wrong.  If you do, change the flavor makeup of these meatballs because the sauce you use cannot make up for the blandness of the meatball itself.

We ordered the steak, a chicken curry and the fried chicken rice plate.  All were basic and completely standard fare.  

Maybe we ordered the wrong items.  But I'm not willing to go back.  Sorry.
author: C C.

description: Saap Ver was fantastic!  I really loved the food. I had the Basil Duck entree and it was amazing. The tom kha gai soup was excellent.  I highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Mike S.

description: As tenant who resides in the Metro at Showplace Square complex and a former patron of the restaurant, I've grown increasingly frustrated with how Saap Ver operate as a business. With no regard for the tenants above, they regularly hold after hours karoake parties into the early morning. They seemed to be more concerned with having a good time than serving its customers. Never had any issues with the former restaurant, Grand Pu Bah, who's owners were always respectful of those they were sharing a space with.
author: Biscuits G.

description: Portions were large! Got a vegetarian curry- so delicious! Fast service and fresh, hot, spicy food!
author: Payal M.

description: I was part of 12-person party. The atmosphere was very friendly with Thai movie posters on the wall and flags strung across the ceiling, like being in an outside food park. The staff were very courteous and friendly at all times. We did have to inquire on a few late drinks and food but the servers were always reassuring and polite. The food was excellent. I had spicy red curry with chicken which was great.
author: David M.

description: My friends came to Saap Ver and just walked in on May 19. They said we are full inside but there's a table outside.  We agreed because there was a heater but the heater never turned up.  We ordered drinks and food at the same time but they wait staff seemed to have forgotten us.  To illustrate, the appetizers came out. They didn't give us napkins or forks or plates.  The drinks came after we finished the appetizers.  We had to ask for silverware and they brought it up.  Then one of the entree came out but the rest didn't.  One of my friends was late so I asked for the check.  It didn't come.  I asked for it again. It didn't come.  Finally, I said we are leaving unless you bring the check.  I also mentioned that they put us outside and forgot about us.  No one cared.  This restaurant didn't really care about their service.  The food was okay but the service was HORRIBLE!  Worst service ever!
author: Manny Y.

description: Omg the food brings me back to  my country, my past, my heritage, and now missing  my parents  cooking. Everything  is  amazing and tasty  good. I would  recommend  this  place to  all my friends. I would  definitely  be  back for more.
author: bouneson s.

description: I really wanted to come here but the numerous reports on Yelp about flies made me decide to wait until the Health Department makes them clean up. I hope the owners read this and realize they need to fix the problem if they want to stay in business.
author: Ruth E.

description: Just go. Try anything, it's really good and the people working here are beyond sweet.
author: Jordan R.

description: I went with a large group of Thai people, including my wife, and the place was resounding success with all of them. To be honest I don't know what specific dishes I ate as all the dishes were ordered by the group. But There was not a single thing I put in my mouth that was not ridiculously delicious! My wife is a huge fan of Northern Thai food and she has not stopped raving about it. Highly recommended. Very cool decor and fantastic service. We may be driving up from San Jose just to dine here again.
author: Greg M.

description:
Cool fun interior design with classic Thai movies on a big screen.

Food fresh and yummy.

Will visit again.
author: Robert M.

description: Some dishes were good. Some were just ok. What we frustrated with the most was how long it took them to bring the foods out. It was a quiet Sunday and there were just a few tables in the restaurant. It also took them over 15 mins to come out and tell us that the dishes we ordered were no longer available. We had to order new dishes which took forever before they arrived at our table. It was a really really long lunch. I also found the price to be on the high end side comparing to other Thai restaurants in SF. I personally don't think I got my money worth for the quality of food and definitely not the the length of time I had to wait.
author: Berserker T.

description: Had takeout so didn't have the chance to enjoy the ambience. Ordered the vegetarian red curry dish with fried tofu. The dish was fairly good! Great balance between sweetness and spiciness. Only reason I gave it four stars rather than five is because the tofu wasn't fried extremely evenly.
author: Ashwin M.

description: Yum!  Super authentic with "spicy" just as expected.  Tom Yum soup was excellent with good depth in flavor. Opted to have it without the noodles and with a bowl of rice instead.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Jessica d.

description: The food is very average and the prices are very high. I lunch plate is close to $20 with taxes and tip. I was hoping for a better new resto and am disappointed.
author: Jane M.

description: Tried this place since I work close by. The food from the two things I have try the Rice Noodle Soup and the Kao Kha Moo is good. But I've definitely have had better. I can't say if everything will be great or not because I've had a lot of Thai friends come in and said the food is so so and I've had some go in and said they really like the food. What I can say though is service isn't that great. The servers sometimes forget to bring you stuff and the food kind of takes forever. The first dish took 20min which isn't bad but the second dish took 45min. Like that's a huge gap between dishes. They're a new place so maybe will give them another try.
author: Sara S.

description: This place is brand new and are only in their soft-opening phase but everything about this Thai restaurant is great. They have an awesome fully-stocked bar run by Summer, one of the nicest and most talented bartenders. The food on their soft-opening menu is extremely authentic and uses fresh and high quality ingredients. They're much better than some of the other Thai places I've tried in SF and is on par if not better than Lers Ros. The ambiance is great, with a newly renovated location. They have great music and a giant projector so it's a great place to grab a drink and watch any sports games while having some great food. Happy hour is all day every day with $5 small plates and appetizers. The chef and owner is always on premise and from the conversations I've had with him, he's extremely passionate about his business and food. I cannot wait to see what they have to offer after their grand opening!
author: Charles W.

description: This place has a great selection of beer and wine. The food was excellent; the best since Thailand. The larb: it grabs you with every bite. The sausage, northern style, tickles the taste buds. Step back in time--Thaitime and enjoy the most aroy food in SF.
author: William C.

description: Super impressed with both menu and service. I grew up with one super legit Thai place and have been consistently disappointed in San Francisco Thai. I have a new favorite for sure.
author: Travis C.

description: I ordered the chicken basil and crispy pork belly and it was really delicious. Great food great environment! Would love to come here again.
author: Abigail M.

description: Love this place. The owner is incredible, food is authentic, service top notch and decor is new and different. I come here weekly if not a few times a month. Some of the best authentic Thai in SF!!
author: Aman V.

description: I was expecting the food quality to be as good as Grand Pu Bah but it changed the menu completely and was disappointing.
author: Hiroshi M.
